722213f-a.text:
Grand Central Yards, Park Avenue south from 47th Street, during the early stages of excavation between Park and Lexington Avenues, seen from between Park and Lexington Avenues, 47th and 48th Streets. The new upper and lower levels of the new Grand Central Terminal are being built on the east side of the yards first, while service is carried on in the western half. The rear facade of the old station has been removed.
About 1907.
Ewing Galloway.
No reproductions.

Neg #461

722214f-a.text:
Park Avenue, the west side at 47th Street, showing 270 Park Avenue, the Hotel Marguery, in the N. W. corner of 47th Street.
This double building was built about 1918.
About 1922.
Gift of E.M. Jenks.

722212f-a.text:
Park Avenue, north from 47th Street, showing east side. On the east side, going north is shown the Park Lane (1924). The Railroad Y.M.C.A. (1913-1929) hides St. Bartholomew's Church (1919). The Ambassador Hotel (1920) follows, between 5lst and 52nd Streets.
In the background, the new Ritz Tower rises from the N.W. corner of 57th Street.
The little parks in the center of the avenue have not been altered yet.
1926.
Ewing Galloway, Photographer.
Neg # 833

1508123-a.title: Park Avenue #301 - 47th Street - 50th Street
